We'll need a bit more information to make a decent build for you.

Is this for PvM or PvP?
What sort of environment will you be playing this in? +5 EB weapons and +5 AC items? Can you get +12 to abilities via items?
Are you looking for level 40 builds or will you finish before then? (eg the OC finishes at around 17/18, SoU + HoTU finish at around 27/28)
Do you want a build that's powerful at the end or do you want a build that's easy to level? Sometimes a build can be both but not always.

Rog19/Monk20/SD1 or Rog10/Monk25/SD5 could work if you're looking for a level 40 build.

Hello NeruBlack!

For the OC I think this might be simple and easy to level. 

I've chosen a strength based monk to do damage, it has stealth skills, and to make the most of your stealth skills, I've added a small amount of rogue so you can do extra damage with sneak attack. It adds extra bonuses as well which I won't go into detail right now to avoid complicating things. 

I've chosen to put some skill points into discipline to avoid you getting knocked down, tumble to increase your defenses with +4 to AC, heal so you can use heal kits on yourself or others, and persuade because there are lots of persuade dialogue options in the OC and it is more enjoyable to pass them

If you are struggling remember to put healing potions in the quickbar, and try not to take on too many enemies at once. Your henchman generally are not good at this and will charge into mobs of enemies madly. You will have to issue a 'stand your ground' command to make sure they stay still so you can lure a small number of enemies at a time. Then you will need to issue a 'attack nearest' when your enemies come near enough. To do this, right click your henchman, then select stand your ground



then when the enemies come near enough, right click your henchman and click 'attack nearest'



Initially I would suggest just luring them by them seeing you, but once you are more confident in the game you can switch between a ranged weapon (like a shortbow in this example), shoot an enemy, then unequip this, run back then punch em with your fists.

Throughout the tutorial you will need to play as a rogue, this is largely so you get a lot of extra skill points at level 1, then after you get level 2 you can start to play like a monk and punch em, albeit with extra damage from sneak attack!

In terms of gear, when you do the tutorial equip studded leather and a shortsword at level 1, then when you get to level 2, equip some clothing / monk robes and just use your fists to attack. Your monk abilities will be disabled if you use any armor other than robes/clothing, and much of your monk combat power will be disabled if you use any weapon other than your fists or a Kama
